Hi, I'm Dylen Belanger

I am a Software Engineering student who enjoys discovering innovative solutions to real-world problems.

About

I am Dylen, a dedicated software engineering student at Western University, passionate about transforming innovative ideas into efficient and user-friendly software solutions. Through my degree, I've built a strong foundation in languages like Java and JavaScript, alongside essential development methodologies. In my free time, I've engaged in personal and open-source projects to expand my skills and collaborate with peers, emphasizing the importance of communication and teamwork in software development. I also balance my pursuits with Varsity Track and Field. I'm eager to contribute to the tech industry's growth and innovation through internships, co-op positions, and mentorship opportunities, aiming to make a positive impact in various communities. Let's connect and explore possibilities together!

Projects

MyMindfulM8

React, Python, Flask, SQL

Created at Hack Western 10, a hackathon hosted at Western University, MyMindfulM8 MyMindfulM8 is a health-and-wellness web applications that aims to provide users with insights and evidence-based tools to navigate and improve their overall mental, physical, and social health and well-being.

Memory Card Game

React, JavaScript, Pokemon API, Netlify

This is a dynamic React-based memory card game, leveraging state management and API integration. This project was created to practice React skills, including utilizing hooks and asynchronous functions for smooth user interactions and data retrieval.

Battleship

JavaScript/HTML/CSS, Jest, Webpack, Git

Developed using JavaScript and tested with Jest. This project is a digital implementation of the classic game 'Battleship,' showcasing skills in Test Driven Development (TDD), modular code organization, effective DOM manipulation, and strategic game logic.

To-Do List

JavaScript/HTML/CSS, Webpack, Git

Developed using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. This project demonstrates skills in creating dynamic todo-items, organizing code using modules, handling user interactions, and adding persistence using the Web Storage API.

Weather Forecast App

JavaScript/HTML/CSS, Webpack, Git

Created using HTML, CSS and JavaScript. This is a Weather Forecast site that allows users to search for a specific location and view the weather information. The weather data is fetched using WeatherAPI. This project demonstrates skills in working with APIs, handling user input, processing JSON data, and dynamically updating the webpage.
